alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 07 at 4:20PM CDT until July 07 at 5:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Western Deaf Smith County in the Panhandle of Texas... * Until 530 PM CDT. * At 420 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 8 miles west of Bootleg, or 21 miles northwest of Friona, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. * Locations impacted include... Hereford, Simms and Bootleg. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
